heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.8°C), outside temperature (down 4.3°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 11143 lux) and cloud levels (up 547 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12448 lux) and cloud levels (up 1115 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 547.5m lower than yesterday, 730.1m lower than the past week, 1115.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 866m to a maximum of 3020m, averaging 1169.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1899.8m and 2280m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
